title: Jayce
body: Every time I switch to hammer stance on Jayce, there's a small mini lag spike. Am I the only one that has this?

replies.body:
This one was quite a journey. Finally figured out what's causing it with the help of our compatibility lab (they have lots of machines with different hardware specs) and some creative scripting.

Turns out that the there's an image file that should have been cached on Thundering Blow that's, instead, being reloaded every time we switch to that spell. I'm wrapping up a fix to make it so that all of the textures like this one will be cached, so we only have to load them once.

To be clear, this will be in 6.22. Patch 6.21 is already printed on the punch cards, ready to be shoved into the mainframes.

I'm annoyed for one simple reason: Why has it taken this long to even acknowledge and get a Rioter to post about the bug? It's been around since April at least. I personally reported it on Reddit's mega thread multiple times, with other major FPS Freezing bugs, and not a single response even though it was upvoted 20+ times. A single response goes a long way.

The other bugs I've encountered that impact performance are: Sion when he dies in his passive, has a quick freeze. Ryze when he casts his ultimate (which also moves camera to where Ryze is and then scrolls to where he is teleporting to for some reason? It's very disorienting when it happens) causes another quick freeze. Yasuo in general causes FPS drops especially in teamfights in games that starts 25-30 minutes into the game so I assume it's a memory leak? This has been happening just as long as Jayce, if not longer.

This isn't to say I'm not appreciative of this finally being addressed, I definitely am, but the simple question here is "why did this take so long?" and why hasn't it even been acknowledged by Riot? I know you don't really want to promote bugs to be abused in games, but leaving it alone (Jayce for example which is April at least..) that's a lot of months of no answers, and impacted games.
